ygData.subject: SV: Perhaps the Gemchopper needs an actual gem to work?
ygData.msgSnippet: Or gem in one hand and chopper in the outher ? Askur ... From: Madgrizzle  To:  Sent: Tuesday, January
ygData.messageBody:
Or gem in one hand and chopper in the outher ?



Askur

----- Original Message -----
From: Madgrizzle <madgrizzle@...>
To: <EQ_Tinkering@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, January 25, 2000 4:33 PM
Subject: Re: [EQ_Tinkering] Perhaps the Gemchopper needs an actual gem to work?


> From: Madgrizzle <madgrizzle@...>
>
> Click on the item to place it onto the cursor, then right click it on top
> of the gem. This is how a rogue applies poison to his dagger, he selects
> the dagger with the cursor so that it appears ontop of the cursor, then he
> right clicks the poison (and waits 8 seconds now) and places the dagger
> back in his primary slot. This would seem to be the best way of using the
> gemchopper if its not a container. Very good idea FizzWizz, you beat me to
> it :)
>
>
>
> >Talked to a GM after I made my first chopper, all he said was that it
> >chops gems... Has anyone tried right clicking on it or something to see if
> >it can be used directly on a gem? Seems to be pretty fucking worthless as
> >a gem chopper to me.
> >
> >FizzWizz of Tunare
>
>
